quote: My mother said to me, 'If you are a soldier, you will become a general. If you are a monk, you will become the Pope.' Instead, I was a painter, and became Picasso.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Having children is my greatest achievement. It was my saviour. It switched my focus from the outside to the inside. My children are gifts, they remind me of what's important.
author: Elle Macpherson

quote: An ounce of mother is worth a pound of clergy.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: When you are a mother, you are never really alone in your thoughts. A mother always has to think twice, once for herself and once for her child.
author: Sophia Loren

quote: My mother had a great deal of trouble with me, but I think she enjoyed it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Mothers are fonder than fathers of their children because they are more certain they are their own.
author: Aristotle

quote: When your mother asks, 'Do you want a piece of advice?' it is a mere formality. It doesn't matter if you answer yes or no. You're going to get it anyway.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: That strong mother doesn't tell her cub, Son, stay weak so the wolves can get you. She says, Toughen up, this is reality we are living in.
author: Lauryn Hill

quote: Men are what their mothers made them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The heart of a mother is a deep abyss at the bottom of which you will always find forgiveness.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: My mother thinks I am the best. And I was raised to always believe what my mother tells me.
author: Diego Maradona

quote: My mother used to tell me man gives the award, God gives the reward. I don't need another plaque.
author: Denzel Washington

quote: Sweater, n.: garment worn by child when its mother is feeling chilly.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Motherhood is the greatest thing and the hardest thing.
author: Ricki Lake

quote: Motherhood is a great honor and privilege, yet it is also synonymous with servanthood. Every day women are called upon to selflessly meet the needs of their families. Whether they are awake at night nursing a baby, spending their time and money on less-than-grateful teenagers, or preparing meals, moms continuously put others before themselves.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: The natural state of motherhood is unselfishness. When you become a mother, you are no longer the center of your own universe. You relinquish that position to your children.
author: Jessica Lange

quote: How simple a thing it seems to me that to know ourselves as we are, we must know our mothers names.
author: Alice Walker

quote: My mother taught me to treat a lady respectfully.
author: Chris Brown

quote: Only God Himself fully appreciates the influence of a Christian mother in the molding of character in her children.
author: Billy Graham

quote: The fastest way to break the cycle of perfectionism and become a fearless mother is to give up the idea of doing it perfectly - indeed to embrace uncertainty and imperfection.
author: Arianna Huffington

quote: Some are kissing mothers and some are scolding mothers, but it is love just the same, and most mothers kiss and scold together.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: I am sure that if the mothers of various nations could meet, there would be no more wars.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: The mother's heart is the child's schoolroom.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Mothers are all slightly insane.
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: Only mothers can think of the future - because they give birth to it in their children.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: Mother is far too clever to understand anything she does not like.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: My mother's wonderful. To me she's perfection.
author: Michael Jackson

quote: What greater aspiration and challenge are there for a mother than the hope of raising a great son or daughter?
author: Rose Kennedy

quote: My mom has made it possible for me to be who I am. Our family is everything. Her greatest skill was encouraging me to find my own person and own independence.
author: Charlize Theron

quote: The woman is uniformly sacrificed to the wife and mother.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: The biggest surprise, which is also the best, is that I didn't know I would love motherhood as much as I do.
author: Deborah Norville

quote: The mother-child relationship is paradoxical and, in a sense, tragic. It requires the most intense love on the mother's side, yet this very love must help the child grow away from the mother, and to become fully independent.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Tired mothers find that spanking takes less time than reasoning and penetrates sooner to the seat of the memory.
author: Will Durant

quote: A father may turn his back on his child, brothers and sisters may become inveterate enemies, husbands may desert their wives, wives their husbands. But a mother's love endures through all.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Throughout my life, my mom has been the person that I've always looked up to.
author: Mike Krzyzewski

quote: I was raised by a single mother who made a way for me. She used to scrub floors as a domestic worker, put a cleaning rag in her pocketbook and ride the subways in Brooklyn so I would have food on the table. But she taught me as I walked her to the subway that life is about not where you start, but where you're going. That's family values.
author: Al Sharpton

quote: The man in our society is the breadwinner; the woman has enough to do as the homemaker, wife and mother.
author: Dorothy Fields

quote: Every man must define his identity against his mother. If he does not, he just falls back into her and is swallowed up.
author: Camille Paglia

quote: The real menace in dealing with a five-year-old is that in no time at all you begin to sound like a five-year-old.
author: Jean Kerr

quote: My mother taught me about the power of inspiration and courage, and she did it with a strength and a passion that I wish could be bottled.
author: Carly Fiorina

quote: Motherhood has a very humanizing effect. Everything gets reduced to essentials.
author: Meryl Streep

quote: I am truly my mother's son.
author: David Geffen

quote: I owe much to mother. She had an expert's understanding, but also approached art emotionally.
author: David Rockefeller

quote: My sisters and mom raised me to respect women and open doors for them.
author: Milo Ventimiglia

quote: There are only two things a child will share willingly; communicable diseases and its mother's age.
author: Benjamin Spock

quote: Motherhood is priced Of God, at price no man may dare To lessen or misunderstand.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: A woman must combine the role of mother, wife and politician.
author: Emma Bonino

quote: It is not until you become a mother that your judgment slowly turns to compassion and understanding.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: My mother gave me a sense of independence, a sense of total confidence that we could do whatever it was we set out to do. That's how we were raised.
author: Robin Wright

quote: I loved raising my kids. I loved the process, the dirt of it, the tears of it, the frustration of it, Christmas, Easter, birthdays, growth charts, pediatrician appointments. I loved all of it.
author: Jane Elliot

quote: Being a mother is hard and it wasn't a subject I ever studied.
author: Ruby Wax

quote: Motherhood is the strangest thing, it can be like being one's own Trojan horse.
author: Rebecca West

quote: My parents, especially my mother, were no influence on me whatsoever.
author: Andy Partridge

quote: Clearly, society has a tremendous stake in insisting on a woman's natural fitness for the career of mother: the alternatives are all too expensive.
author: Ann Oakley

quote: Mothers and children are human beings, and they will sometimes do the wrong thing.
author: Maurice Sendak

quote: Motherhood is the only thing in my life that I've really known for sure is something I wanted to do.
author: Cynthia Nixon

quote: Morality and its victim, the mother - what a terrible picture! Is there indeed anything more terrible, more criminal, than our glorified sacred function of motherhood?
author: Emma Goldman

quote: I wanted to escape so badly. But of course I knew I couldn't just give up and leave school. It was only when I heard my mom's voice that I came out of my hiding place.
author: Zhang Ziyi

quote: Mothers are the necessity of invention.
author: Bill Watterson

quote: The Vatican is against surrogate mothers. Good thing they didn't have that rule when Jesus was born.
author: Elayne Boosler
